null.verse 8:66: Nyní vám Bůh ulehčil, neboť dobře ví, že mezi vámi je slabost.
null.verse 8:67: Nebylo dáno proroku žádnému, aby měl zajatce, pokud dokonale neporazil nepřátele na zemi.
null.verse 8:68: A kdyby nebylo příkazu již dříve od Boha daného, byl by se vás dotkl trest nesmírný za to, co jste si vzali.
null.verse 8:69: Jezte z toho, co jste ukořistili, jen dovolené a výtečné a bojte se Boha, vždyť Bůh je odpouštějící, slitovný.
null.verse 8:70: Proroku! Rci těm ze zajatců, kteří jsou v rukou vašich: "Rozezná-li Bůh něco dobrého v srdcích vašich, daruje vám lepší než to, co bylo vám vzato, a odpustí vám, neboť Bůh je odpouštějící, slitovný.
null.verse 8:71: A hodlají-li tě zradit nyní, vždyť již předtím zradili Boha, avšak On vám umožnil se jich zmocnit, neboť Bůh vševědoucí je i moudrý.
null.verse 8:72: Vskutku ti, kdož uvěřili, přesídlili a vedli boj majetky i osobami svými na stezce Boží, a ti, kdož jim útulek poskytli a pomohli jim - ti všichni jsou si navzájem přáteli.
null.verse 8:73: Ti, kdož neuvěřili, jsou si navzájem přáteli.
null.verse 8:74: Věru ti, kdož uvěřili, přesídlili a vedli boj na cestě Boží, a ti, kdož jim útulek poskytli a pomohli jim, ti všichni jsou pravými věřícími a jim dostane se odpuštění i přídělu štědrého.
null.verse 8:75: A ti, kdož později uvěřili, přesídlili a bojovali spolu s vámi, ti také patří k vám; avšak ti, kdož pokrevně spřízněni jsou, jsou si vzájemně nejbližší podle příkazu Božího a Bůh ví o věcech všech.

null.verse 8:1: Zij vragen u over de oorlogsbuit.
null.verse 8:2: Ware gelovigen zijn slechts degenen wier hart vol vrees klopt, wanneer de naam van God wordt genoemd en wanneer Zijn tekenen hun worden voorgelezen, doet dit hen in geloof toenemen en op hun Heer vertrouwen.
null.verse 8:3: Die het gebed houden en van hetgeen, waarmee Wij hen hebben voorzien, meedelen,
null.verse 8:4: Dezen zijn de ware gelovigen.
null.verse 8:5: Toen uw Heer u in waarheid van uw huis deed weggaan, was een gedeelte van de gelovigen er afkerig van.
null.verse 8:6: Zij redetwistten met u over de waarheid nadat deze was bekend gemaakt alsof zij zienderogen tot de dood werden gedreven.
null.verse 8:7: En toen God u één der twee partijen beloofde dat zij de uwe zou zijn, wenste je, dat de partij zonder wapenen de uwe zou worden, maar God wilde door Zijn Woorden de waarheid bevestigen en de levenswortel der ongelovigen afsnijden.
null.verse 8:8: Opdat Hij de waarheid mocht bevestigen en de leugen teniet mocht doen, ofschoon de schuldigen er afkerig van zijn.
null.verse 8:9: Toen gij de hulp van uw Heer afsmeektet en Hij u antwoordde: "Ik zal u met duizend engelen helpen die elkander opvolgen.
null.verse 8:10: God gaf het slechts als verblijdend nieuws en opdat uw hart daardoor mocht worden gerustgesteld.
null.verse 8:11: Toen Hij slaap over u deed komen als beveiliging van Hem en water van de wolken over u neerzond, opdat Hij u daardoor mocht reinigen en het vuil van Satan van u mocht verwijderen en opdat Hij uw hart mocht sterken en u mocht doen volhouden.
null.verse 8:12: Toen uw Heer aan de engelen openbaarde: "Ik ben met u; versterkt de gelovigen.
null.verse 8:13: Dit is, omdat zij zich tegen God en Zijn boodschapper hebben verzet.
null.verse 8:14: Dat is (uw straf), ondergaat haar daarom en weet dat er voor de ongelovigen de straf van het Vuur is.
null.verse 8:15: O, gij die gelooft, wanneer gij degenen die niet geloven, op u af ziet komen wendt hun dan niet uw rug toe.
null.verse 8:16: En wie op die dag zijn rug toekeert, tenzij hij voor het gevecht manoeuvreert of om plaats te nemen bij een andere groep, doet inderdaad de toorn van God over zich komen en de hel zal zijn tehuis zijn en dat is een slechte verblijfplaats.
null.verse 8:17: Gij dooddet hen niet, doch God was het, Die hen doodde.
null.verse 8:18: Dit (geschiedde) en voorzeker is God degene, Die het plan van de ongelovigen verijdelt.
null.verse 8:19: Als gij een oordeel zoekt, dan is het oordeel reeds tot u gekomen.
null.verse 8:20: O, gij die gelooft, gehoorzaamt God en Zijn boodschapper en wendt u niet van hem af, terwijl gij hoort.
null.verse 8:21: En weest niet zoals degenen, die zeggen: "Wij horen," maar zij horen niet.
null.verse 8:22: Voorzeker, erger dan de beesten zijn in de ogen van God de doven en de stommen die niet willen begrijpen.
null.verse 8:23: Als God enig goed in hen had ontdekt, zou Hij hen voorzeker hebben doen horen.
null.verse 8:24: O, gij die gelooft, geeft gehoor aan God en de boodschapper wanneer Hij u roept, opdat Hij u leven moge geven en weet, dat God tussen een man en zijn hart komt en dat Hij het is tot Wie gij zult worden vergaderd.
null.verse 8:25: En behoedt u voor het onheil, dat niet alleen degenen, die onder u kwaad doen zal treffen.
null.verse 8:26: En gedenkt, toen gij weinigen waart en zwak werd geacht in het land en toen gij vreesdet, dat de mensen u weg zouden voeren, hoe Hij u beschermde en sterkte met Zijn hulp en u voorzag van goede dingen, opdat gij dankbaar mocht zijn.
null.verse 8:27: O, gij die gelooft, weest God en de boodschapper niet ontrouw en weest niet ontrouw aan het u toevertrouwde tegen beter weten in.
null.verse 8:28: En weet, dat uw bezittingen en uw kinderen slechts een beproeving zijn en dat voorzeker bij God een grote beloning is.
null.verse 8:29: O, gij die gelooft, als gij God vreest zal Hij u een onderscheiding verlenen en uw tekortkomingen voor u bedekken en u vergeven; God is Heer van grote Genade.
null.verse 8:30: Toen smeedden de ongelovigen tegan u plannen, opdat zij u gevangen mochten nemen of doden of verbannen.
null.verse 8:31: En wanneer Onze verzen worden voorgelezen aan hen, zeggen zij: "Wij hebben het gehoord.
null.verse 8:32: En toen zij zeiden: "O God, als dit inderdaad de waarheid van U is, doe dan stenen uit de hemel over ons regenen of geef ons een (andere) smartelijke straf.
null.verse 8:33: Maar God zal hen niet straffen zolang gij onder hen zijt noch zal God hen straffen indien zij om vergiffenis vragen.
null.verse 8:34: Waarom zal God hen niet straffen, wanneer zij de mensen beletten de heilige moskee binnen te gaan en er geen bewakers van zijn? De bewakers er van zijn alleen de godvruchtigen, maar de meesten hunner beseffen het niet.
null.verse 8:35: En hun gebed in het Huis (de Kaaba) is niet anders dan fluiten en klappen in de handen.
null.verse 8:36: Voorzeker, de ongelovigen besteden hun rijkdommen om anderen van de weg van God af te leiden.
null.verse 8:37: Zodat God de bozen van de goeden moge scheiden en de bozen bij elkander moge drijven en hen allen tezamen moge ophopen en hen dan in de hel moge werpen.
null.verse 8:38: Zeg tot degenen die niet geloven, dat als zij ophouden (u te vervolgen), hetgeen voorby is hen zal worden vergeven en indien zij er weer in vervallen, voorwaar, dan is er akeeds het voorbeeld van vroegere volkeren.
null.verse 8:39: En bestrijdt hen totdat er geen vervolging is en de godsdienst geheel voor God wordt.
null.verse 8:40: En als zij terugvallen weet dan, dat God uw Beschermer is, een uitstekende Beschermer en een uitstekende Helper.
null.verse 8:41: En weet, dat wat gij ook als buit neemt, er een vijfde van voor God, de boodschapper, de verwanten, de wezen, de armen en de reiziger is, - indien gij in God gelooft en in hetgeen Wij aan Onze dienaar op de dag der onderscheiding neerzonden, de dag waarop de twee legers elkander ontmoetten.
null.verse 8:42: Toen gij op de nabijzijnde kant waart en zij zich op de andere zijde bevonden en de karavaan beneden u was; en indien gij een onderlinge afspraak hadt gemaakt, zoud je ten opzichte van die afspraak zeker (van mening) hebben verschild.
null.verse 8:43: Gedenk de tijd toen God hen (de vijanden) in uw ogen als weinigen toonde; had Hij hen u als velen getoond, dan zou je voorzeker hebben geweifeld en met elkander over de zaak getwist; maar God bewaarde u; voorzeker, Hij heeft volle kennis over hetgeen in het innerlijk is.
null.verse 8:44: En toen Hij hen in de tijd van uw ontmoeting als weinigen in uw ogen deed voorkomen en u als weinigen in hun ogen deed voorkomen, zodat God hetgeen gedaan moest worden tot stand mocht brengen.
null.verse 8:45: O, gij die gelooft, blijft standvastig wanneer gij een leger (van ongelovigen) ontmoet en gedenkt God vaak, opdat gij moogt slagen.
null.verse 8:46: En gehoorzaamt God en Zijn boodschapper en redetwist niet met elkander, anders zul je laf worden en uw kracht zal vergaan.
null.verse 8:47: En weest niet zoals degenen die pochend uit hun huizen kwamen om door de mensen te worden gezien en om anderen van het pad van God af te leiden; en God omvat al hetgeen zij doen.
null.verse 8:48: Toen deed Satan hun hun daden schoon schijnen en zeide: "Niemand onder de mensen zal deze dag de overhand over u hebben want ik ben uw metgezel.
null.verse 8:49: Toen de huichelaars en degenen in wier hart een ziekte is, zeiden: "Hun (Moslims) geloof heeft dezen bedrogen.
null.verse 8:50: O, had je het slechts kunnen zien, wanneer de engelen de ziel der ongelovigen wegnemen, hun gezicht en hun rug treffende: "Ondergaat de straf van het branden.
null.verse 8:51: Dit komt door hetgeen uw handen hebben gewrocht; God is in het geheel niet onrechtvaardig voor Zijn dienaren.
null.verse 8:52: Zoals het volk van Pharao en degenen die vóór hen waren; zij verwierpen de tekenen van God, daarom strafte God hen voor hun zonden.
null.verse 8:53: Dit is omdat God nooit een gunst die Hij een volk heeft bewezen zal veranderen totdat zij, wat in hun hart is, veranderen.
null.verse 8:54: Zoals het volk van Pharao en degenen, die vóór hen waren; zij verloochenden de tekenen van hun Heer daarom vernietigden Wij hen voor hun zonden.
null.verse 8:55: Voorzeker, in de ogen van God zijn zij, die (de waarheid) verwerpen erger dan beesten want zij willen niet geloven:
null.verse 8:56: Degenen met wie gij een verbond sluit, daarna schenden zij dit verbond telkens weer en zij vrezen niet.
null.verse 8:57: Als gij hen in de oorlog ontmoet, jaagt dan degenen die achter hen zign vrees aan wegens hen, opdat zij er lering uit mogen trekken.
null.verse 8:58: En als gij ontrouw van een volk vreest verstoot hen dan op gelijke wijze.
null.verse 8:59: En laat de ongelovigen niet denken dat zij een voorsprong hebben.
null.verse 8:60: En maakt aan de grens alle mogelijke strijdkrachten en vastgehouden paarden voor hen gereed, waarmee gij de vijand van God en uw vijand en anderen buiten hen, die gij niet kent, doch die God kent, moogt afschrikken.
null.verse 8:61: En als zij tot vrede neigen, neigt u er dan ook toe en legt uw vertrouwen in God.
null.verse 8:62: En als zij u willen bedriegen is God voorzeker (als Helper) toereikend voor u.
null.verse 8:63: en Hij heeft hun harten verenigd.
null.verse 8:64: O profeet, God is toereikend voor u en voor diegenen der gelovigen die u volgen.
null.verse 8:65: O profeet, spoor de gelovigen aan om te vechten.
null.verse 8:66: Maar nu heeft God uw last verlicht, want Hij weet dat er zwakheid in u is.
null.verse 8:67: Een profeet kan geen gevangenen maken voordat hij tot geregeld vechten in het land komt.
null.verse 8:68: En indien er geen gebod van God was geweest zou u voorzeker een grote rampspoed zijn overkomen voor hetgeen gij naamt.
null.verse 8:69: Eet van de buit die gij ontvangt als wettig en goed en vreest God.
null.verse 8:70: O profeet, zeg tot de gevangenen die in uw handen zijn: "Als God enig goed in uw hart vindt, zal Hij u beter geven dan hetgeen van u is weggenomen en zal Hij u vergeven".
null.verse 8:71: Maar als zij voornemens zijn u ontrouw te worden, zijn zij reeds voorheen God ontrouw geweest, daarom gaf Hij u macht over hen.
null.verse 8:72: Voorzeker, degenen die hebben geloofd en hun huizen verlieten en met hun bezittingen en hun persoon voor de zaak van God hebben gestreden en degenen die schuilplaats verstrekten en hielpen, zijn vrienden van elkander.
null.verse 8:73: De ongelovigen zijn vrienden van elkander.
null.verse 8:74: En degenen die geloven en hun huizen verlaten en die streden voor de zaak van God en degenen die hun schuilplaats verstrekken en hen helpen zijn de ware gelovigen.
null.verse 8:75: En degenen die naderhand zullen geloven en hun huizen verlaten en tezamen met u strijden, zullen tot u behoren; en bloedverwanten staan nader tot elkander in het Boek van God.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:1: They ask thee (O Muhammad) of the spoils of war.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:2: They only are the (true) believers whose hearts feel fear when Allah is mentioned, and when His revelations are recited unto them they increase their faith, and who trust in their Lord;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:3: Who establish worship and spend of that We have bestowed on them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:4: Those are they who are in truth believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:5: Even as thy Lord caused thee (Muhammad) to go forth from thy home with the Truth, and lo! a party of the believers were averse (to it).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:6: Disputing with thee of the Truth after it had been made manifest, as if they were being driven to death visible.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:7: And when Allah promised you one of the two bands (of the enemy) that it should be yours, and ye longed that other than the armed one might be yours.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:8: That He might cause the Truth to triumph and bring vanity to naught, however much the guilty might oppose;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:9: When ye sought help of your Lord and He answered you (saying): I will help you with a thousand of the angels, rank on rank.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:10: Allah appointed it only as good tidings, and that your hearts thereby might be at rest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:11: When He made the slumber fall upon you as a reassurance from him and sent down water from the sky upon you, that thereby He might purify you, and remove from you the fear of Satan, and make strong your hearts and firm (your) feet thereby.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:12: When thy Lord inspired the angels, (saying): I am with you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:13: That is because they opposed Allah and His messenger.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:14: That (is the award), so taste it, and (know) that for disbelievers is the torment of the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:15: O ye who believe! When ye meet those who disbelieve in battle, turn not your backs to them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:16: Whoso on that day turneth his back to them, unless manoeuvring for battle or intent to join a company, he truly hath incurred wrath from Allah, and his habitation will be hell, a hapless journey’s end.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:17: Ye (Muslims) slew them not, but Allah slew them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:18: That (is the case); and (know) that Allah (it is) Who maketh weak the plan of disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:19: (O Qureysh!) If ye sought a judgment, now hath the judgment come unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:20: O ye who believe! Obey Allah and His messenger, and turn not away from him when ye hear (him speak).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:21: Be not as those who say, we hear, and they hear not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:22: Lo! the worst of beasts in Allah’s sight are the deaf, the dumb, who have no sense.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:23: Had Allah known of any good in them He would have made them hear, but had He made them hear they would have turned away, averse.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:24: O ye who believe! Obey Allah, and the messenger when He calleth you to that which quickeneth you, and know that Allah cometh in between the man and his own heart, and that He it is unto Whom ye will be gathered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:25: And guard yourselves against a chastisement which cannot fall exclusively on those of you who are wrong-doers, and know that Allah is severe in punishment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:26: And remember, when ye were few and reckoned feeble in the land, and were in fear lest men should extirpate you, how He gave you refuge, and strengthened you with His help, and made provision of good things for you, that haply ye might be thankful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:27: O ye who believe! Betray not Allah and His messenger, nor knowingly betray your trusts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:28: And know that your possessions and your children are a test, and that with Allah is immense reward.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:29: O ye who believe! If ye keep your duty to Allah, He will give you discrimination (between right and wrong) and will rid you of your evil thoughts and deeds, and will forgive you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:30: And when those who disbelieve plot against thee (O Muhammad) to wound thee fatally, or to kill thee or to drive thee forth; they plot, but Allah (also) plotteth; and Allah is the best of plotters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:31: And when Our revelations are recited unto them they say: We have heard.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:32: And when they said: O Allah! If this be indeed the truth from Thee, then rain down stones on us or bring on us some painful doom!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:33: But Allah would not punish them while thou wast with them, nor will He punish them while they seek forgiveness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:34: What (plea) have they that Allah should not punish them, when they debar (His servants) from the Inviolable Place of Worship, though they are not its fitting guardians.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:35: And their worship at the (holy) House is naught but whistling and hand-clapping.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:36: Lo! those who disbelieve spend their wealth in order that they may debar (men) from the way of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:37: That Allah may separate the wicked from the good, The wicked will He place piece upon piece, and heap them all together, and consign them unto hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:38: Tell those who disbelieve that if they cease (from persecution of believers) that which is past will be forgiven them; but if they return (thereto) then the example of the men of old hath already gone (before them, for a warning).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:39: And fight them until persecution is no more, and religion is all for Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:40: And if they turn away, then know that Allah is your Befriender - a Transcendent Patron, a Transcendent Helper!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:41: And know that whatever ye take as spoils of war, lo! a fifth thereof is for Allah, and for the messenger and for the kinsman (who hath need) and orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, if ye believe in Allah and that which We revealed unto Our slave on the Day of Discrimination, the day when the two armies met.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:42: When ye were on the near bank (of the valley) and they were on the yonder bank, and the caravan was below you (on the coast plain).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:43: When Allah showed them unto thee (O Muhammad) in thy dream as few in number, and if He had shown them to thee as many, ye (Muslims) would have faltered and would have quarrelled over the affair.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:44: And when He made you (Muslims), when ye met (them), see them with your eyes as few, and lessened you in their eyes, (it was) that Allah might conclude a thing that must be done.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:45: O ye who believe! When ye meet an army, hold firm and think of Allah much, that ye may be successful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:46: And obey Allah and His messenger, and dispute not one with another lest ye falter and your strength depart from you; but be steadfast! Lo! Allah is with the steadfast.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:47: Be not as those who came forth from their dwellings boastfully and to be seen of men, and debar (men) from the way of Allah, while Allah is surrounding all they do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:48: And when Satan made their deeds seem fair to them and said: No-one of mankind can conquer you this day, for I am your protector.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:49: When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease said: Their religion hath deluded these.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:50: If thou couldst see how the angels receive those who disbelieve, smiting faces and their backs and (saying): Taste the punishment of burning!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:51: This is for that which your own hands have sent before (to the Judgment), and (know) that Allah is not a tyrant to His slaves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:52: (Their way is) as the way of Pharaoh’s folk and those before them; they disbelieved the revelations of Allah, and Allah took them in their sins.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:53: That is because Allah never changeth the grace He hath bestowed on any people until they first change that which is in their hearts, and (that is) because Allah is Hearer, Knower.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:54: (Their way is) as the way of Pharaoh’s folk and those before them; they denied the revelations of their Lord, so We destroyed them in their sins.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:55: Lo! the worst of beasts in Allah’s sight are the ungrateful who will not believe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:56: Those of them with whom thou madest a treaty, and then at every opportunity they break their treaty, and they keep not duty (to Allah).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:57: If thou comest on them in the war, deal with them so as to strike fear in those who are behind them, that haply they may remember.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:58: And if thou fearest treachery from any folk, then throw back to them (their treaty) fairly.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:59: And let not those who disbelieve suppose that they can outstrip (Allah’s Purpose).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:60: Make ready for them all thou canst of (armed) force and of horses tethered, that thereby ye may dismay the enemy of Allah and your enemy, and others beside them whom ye know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:61: And if they incline to peace, incline thou also to it, and trust in Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:62: And if they would deceive thee, then lo! Allah is Sufficient for thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:63: And (as for the believers) hath attuned their hearts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:64: O Prophet! Allah is Sufficient for thee and those who follow thee of the believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:65: O Prophet! Exhort the believers to fight.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:66: Now hath Allah lightened your burden, for He knoweth that there is weakness in you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:67: It is not for any prophet to have captives until he hath made slaughter in the land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:68: Had it not been for an ordinance of Allah which had gone before, an awful doom had come upon you on account of what ye took.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:69: Now enjoy what ye have won, as lawful and good, and keep your duty to Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:70: O Prophet! Say unto those captives who are in your hands: If Allah knoweth any good in your hearts He will give you better than that which hath been taken from you, and will forgive you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:71: And if they would betray thee, they betrayed Allah before, and He gave (thee) power over them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:72: Lo! those who believed and left their homes and strove with their wealth and their lives for the cause of Allah, and those who took them in and helped them: these are protecting friends one of another.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:73: And those who disbelieve are protectors one of another - If ye do not so, there will be confusion in the land, and great corruption.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:74: Those who believed and left their homes and strove for the cause of Allah, and those who took them in and helped them - these are the believers in truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 8:75: And those who afterwards believed and left their homes and strove along with you, they are of you; and those who are akin are nearer one to another in the ordinance of Allah.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:1: They ask thee concerning (things taken as) spoils of war.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:2: For, Believers are those who, when God is mentioned, feel a tremor in their hearts, and when they hear His signs rehearsed, find their faith strengthened, and put (all) their trust in their Lord;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:3: Who establish regular prayers and spend (freely) out of the gifts We have given them for sustenance:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:4: Such in truth are the believers: they have grades of dignity with their Lord, and forgiveness, and generous sustenance:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:5: Just as thy Lord ordered thee out of thy house in truth, even though a party among the Believers disliked it,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:6: Disputing with thee concerning the truth after it was made manifest, as if they were being driven to death and they (actually) saw it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:7: Behold! God promised you one of the two (enemy) parties, that it should be yours: Ye wished that the one unarmed should be yours, but God willed to justify the Truth according to His words and to cut off the roots of the Unbelievers;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:8: That He might justify Truth and prove Falsehood false, distasteful though it be to those in guilt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:9: Remember ye implored the assistance of your Lord, and He answered you: "I will assist you with a thousand of the angels, ranks on ranks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:10: God made it but a message of hope, and an assurance to your hearts: (in any case) there is no help except from God: and God is Exalted in Power, Wise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:11: Remember He covered you with a sort of drowsiness, to give you calm as from Himself, and he caused rain to descend on you from heaven, to clean you therewith, to remove from you the stain of Satan, to strengthen your hearts, and to plant your feet firmly therewith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:12: Remember thy Lord inspired the angels (with the message): "I am with you: give firmness to the Believers: I will instil terror into the hearts of the Unbelievers: smite ye above their necks and smite all their finger-tips off them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:13: This because they contended against God and His Apostle: If any contend against God and His Apostle, God is strict in punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:14: Thus (will it be said): "Taste ye then of the (punishment): for those who resist God, is the penalty of the Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:15: O ye who believe! when ye meet the Unbelievers in hostile array, never turn your backs to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:16: If any do turn his back to them on such a day - unless it be in a stratagem of war, or to retreat to a troop (of his own)- he draws on himself the wrath of God, and his abode is Hell,- an evil refuge (indeed)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:17: It is not ye who slew them; it was God: when thou threwest (a handful of dust), it was not thy act, but God’s: in order that He might test the Believers by a gracious trial from Himself: for God is He Who heareth and knoweth (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:18: That, and also because God is He Who makes feeble the plans and stratagem of the Unbelievers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:19: (O Unbelievers!) if ye prayed for victory and judgment, now hath the judgment come to you: if ye desist (from wrong), it will be best for you: if ye return (to the attack), so shall We.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:20: O ye who believe! Obey God and His Apostle, and turn not away from him when ye hear (him speak).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:21: Nor be like those who say, "We hear," but listen not:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:22: For the worst of beasts in the sight of God are the deaf and the dumb,- those who understand not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:23: If God had found in them any good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:24: O ye who believe! give your response to God and His Apostle, when He calleth you to that which will give you life; and know that God cometh in between a man and his heart, and that it is He to Whom ye shall (all) be gathered.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:25: And fear tumult or oppression, which affecteth not in particular (only) those of you who do wrong: and know that God is strict in punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:26: Call to mind when ye were a small (band), despised through the land, and afraid that men might despoil and kidnap you; But He provided a safe asylum for you, strengthened you with His aid, and gave you Good things for sustenance: that ye might be grateful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:27: O ye that believe! betray not the trust of God and the Apostle, nor misappropriate knowingly things entrusted to you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:28: And know ye that your possessions and your progeny are but a trial; and that it is God with Whom lies your highest reward.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:29: O ye who believe! if ye fear God, He will grant you a criterion (to judge between right and wrong), remove from you (all) evil (that may afflict) you, and forgive you: for God is the Lord of grace unbounded.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:30: Remember how the Unbelievers plotted against thee, to keep thee in bonds, or slay thee, or get thee out (of thy home).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:31: When Our Signs are rehearsed to them, they say: "We have heard this (before): if we wished, we could say (words) like these: these are nothing but tales of the ancients.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:32: Remember how they said: "O God if this is indeed the Truth from Thee, rain down on us a shower of stones form the sky, or send us a grievous penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:33: But God was not going to send them a penalty whilst thou wast amongst them; nor was He going to send it whilst they could ask for pardon.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:34: But what plea have they that God should not punish them, when they keep out (men) from the sacred Mosque - and they are not its guardians? No men can be its guardians except the righteous; but most of them do not understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:35: Their prayer at the House (of God) is nothing but whistling and clapping of hands: (Its only answer can be), "Taste ye the penalty because ye blasphemed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:36: The Unbelievers spend their wealth to hinder (man) from the path of God, and so will they continue to spend; but in the end they will have (only) regrets and sighs; at length they will be overcome: and the Unbelievers will be gathered together to Hell;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:37: In order that God may separate the impure from the pure, put the impure, one on another, heap them together, and cast them into Hell.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:38: Say to the Unbelievers, if (now) they desist (from Unbelief), their past would be forgiven them; but if they persist, the punishment of those before them is already (a matter of warning for them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:39: And fight them on until there is no more tumult or oppression, and there prevail justice and faith in God altogether and everywhere; but if they cease, verily God doth see all that they do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:40: If they refuse, be sure that God is your Protector - the best to protect and the best to help.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:41: And know that out of all the booty that ye may acquire (in war), a fifth share is assigned to God,- and to the Apostle, and to near relatives, orphans, the needy, and the wayfarer,- if ye do believe in God and in the revelation We sent down to Our servant on the Day of Testing,- the Day of the meeting of the two forces.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:42: Remember ye were on the hither side of the valley, and they on the farther side, and the caravan on lower ground than ye.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:43: Remember in thy dream God showed them to thee as few: if He had shown them to thee as many, ye would surely have been discouraged, and ye would surely have disputed in (your) decision; but God saved (you): for He knoweth well the (secrets) of (all) hearts.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:44: And remember when ye met, He showed them to you as few in your eyes, and He made you appear as contemptible in their eyes: that God might accomplish a matter already enacted.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:45: O ye who believe! When ye meet a force, be firm, and call God in remembrance much (and often); that ye may prosper:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:46: And obey God and His Apostle; and fall into no disputes, lest ye lose heart and your power depart; and be patient and persevering: For God is with those who patiently persevere:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:47: And be not like those who started from their homes insolently and to be seen of men, and to hinder (men) from the path of God: For God compasseth round about all that they do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:48: Remember Satan made their (sinful) acts seem alluring to them, and said: "No one among men can overcome you this day, while I am near to you": But when the two forces came in sight of each other, he turned on his heels, and said: "Lo! I am clear of you; lo! I see what ye see not; Lo! I fear God: for God is strict in punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:49: Lo! the hypocrites say, and those in whose hearts is a disease: "These people,- their religion has misled them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:50: If thou couldst see, when the angels take the souls of the Unbelievers (at death), (How) they smite their faces and their backs, (saying): "Taste the penalty of the blazing Fire-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:51: "Because of (the deeds) which your (own) hands sent forth; for God is never unjust to His servants:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:52: "(Deeds) after the manner of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them: They rejected the Signs of God, and God punished them for their crimes: for God is Strong, and Strict in punishment:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:53: "Because God will never change the grace which He hath bestowed on a people until they change what is in their (own) souls: and verily God is He Who heareth and knoweth (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:54: (Deeds) after the manner of the people of Pharaoh and those before them": They treated as false the Signs of their Lord: so We destroyed them for their crimes, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh: for they were all oppressors and wrong-doers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:55: For the worst of beasts in the sight of God are those who reject Him: They will not believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:56: They are those with whom thou didst make a covenant, but they break their covenant every time, and they have not the fear (of God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:57: If ye gain the mastery over them in war, disperse, with them, those who follow them, that they may remember.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:58: If thou fearest treachery from any group, throw back (their covenant) to them, (so as to be) on equal terms: for God loveth not the treacherous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:59: Let not the unbelievers think that they can get the better (of the godly): they will never frustrate (them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:60: Against them make ready your strength to the utmost of your power, including steeds of war, to strike terror into (the hearts of) the enemies, of God and your enemies, and others besides, whom ye may not know, but whom God doth know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:61: But if the enemy incline towards peace, do thou (also) incline towards peace, and trust in God: for He is One that heareth and knoweth (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:62: Should they intend to deceive thee,- verily God sufficeth thee: He it is That hath strengthened thee with His aid and with (the company of) the Believers;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:63: And (moreover) He hath put affection between their hearts: not if thou hadst spent all that is in the earth, couldst thou have produced that affection, but God hath done it: for He is Exalted in might, Wise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:64: O Apostle! sufficient unto thee is God,- (unto thee) and unto those who follow thee among the Believers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:65: O Apostle! rouse the Believers to the fight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:66: For the present, God hath lightened your (task), for He knoweth that there is a weak spot in you: But (even so), if there are a hundred of you, patient and persevering, they will vanquish two hundred, and if a thousand, they will vanquish two thousand, with the leave of God: for God is with those who patiently persevere.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:67: It is not fitting for an apostle that he should have prisoners of war until he hath thoroughly subdued the land.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:68: Had it not been for a previous ordainment from God, a severe penalty would have reached you for the (ransom) that ye took.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:69: But (now) enjoy what ye took in war, lawful and good: but fear God: for God is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:70: O Apostle! say to those who are captives in your hands: "If God findeth any good in your hearts, He will give you something better than what has been taken from you, and He will forgive you: for God is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:71: But if they have treacherous designs against thee, (O Apostle!), they have already been in treason against God, and so hath He given (thee) power over them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:72: Those who believed, and adopted exile, and fought for the Faith, with their property and their persons, in the cause of God, as well as those who gave (them) asylum and aid,- these are (all) friends and protectors, one of another.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:73: The Unbelievers are protectors, one of another: Unless ye do this, (protect each other), there would be tumult and oppression on earth, and great mischief.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:74: Those who believe, and adopt exile, and fight for the Faith, in the cause of God as well as those who give (them) asylum and aid,- these are (all) in very truth the Believers: for them is the forgiveness of sins and a provision most generous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 8:75: And those who accept Faith subsequently, and adopt exile, and fight for the Faith in your company,- they are of you.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:1: They will question thee concerning the spoils.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:2: Those only are believers who, when God is mentioned, their hearts quake, and when His signs are recited to them, it increases them in faith, and in their Lord they put their trust,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:3: those who perform the prayer, and expend of what We have provided them,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:4: those in truth are the believers; they have degrees with their Lord, and forgiveness, and generous provision.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:5: As thy Lord brought thee forth from thy house with the truth, and a part of the believers were averse to it,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:6: disputing with thee concerning the truth after it had become clear, as though they were being driven into death with their eyes wide open.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:7: And when God promised you one of the two parties should be yours, and you were wishing that the one not accoutred should be yours; but God was desiring to verify the truth by His words, and to cut off the unbelievers to the last remnant,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:8: and that He might verify the truth and prove untrue the untrue, though the sinners were averse to it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:9: When you were calling upon your Lord for succour, and He answered you, ’I shall reinforce you with a thousand angels riding behind you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:10: God wrought this not, save as good tidings and that your hearts thereby might be at rest; help comes only from God; surely God is All-mighty, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:11: When He was causing slumber to overcome you as a security from Him, and sending down on you water from heaven, to purify you thereby, and to put away from you the defilement of Satan, and to strengthen your hearts, and to confirm your feet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:12: When thy Lord was revealing to the angels, ’I am with you; so confirm the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:13: That, because they had made a breach with God and with His Messenger; and whosoever makes a breach with God and with His Messenger, surely God is terrible in retribution.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:14: That for you; therefore taste it; and that the chastisement of the Fire is for the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:15: O believers, when you encounter the unbelievers marching to battle, turn not your backs to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:16: Whoso turns his back that day to them, unless withdrawing to fight again or removing to join another host, he is laden with the burden of God’s anger, and his refuge is Gehenna -- an evil homecoming!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:17: You did not slay them, but God slew them; and when thou threwest, it was not thyself that threw, but God threw, and that He might confer on the believers a fair benefit; surely God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:18: That for you; and that God weakens the unbelievers’ guile.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:19: f victory you are seeking, victory has already come upon you; and if you give over, it is better for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:20: O believers, obey God and His Messenger, and do not turn away from Him, even as you are listening;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:21: and be not as those who say, ’We hear,’ and they hear not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:22: Surely the worst of beasts in God’s sight are those that are deaf and dumb and do not understand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:23: If God had known of any good in them He would have made them hear; and if He had made them hear, they would have turned away, swerving aside.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:24: O believers, respond to God and the Messenger when He calls you unto that which will give you life; and know that God stands between a man and his heart, and that to Him you shall be mustered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:25: And fear a trial which shall surely not smite in particular the evildoers among you; and know that God is terrible in retribution.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:26: And remember when you were few and abased in the land, and were fearful that the people would snatch you away; but He gave you refuge, and confirmed you with His help, and provided you with the good things, that haply you might be thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:27: O believers, betray not God and the Messenger, and betray not your trusts and that wittingly;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:28: and know that your wealth and your children are a trial, and that with God is a mighty wage
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:29: O believers, if you fear God, He will assign you a salvation, and acquit you of your evil deeds, and forgive you; and God is of bounty abounding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:30: And when the unbelievers were devising against thee, to confine thee, or slay thee, or to expel thee, and were devising, and God was devising; and God is the best of devisers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:31: And When Our signs were being recited to them, they said, ’We have already heard; if we wished, we could say the like of this; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:32: And when they said, ’O God, if this be indeed the truth from Thee, then rain down upon us stones out of heaven, or bring us a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:33: But God would never chastise them, with thee among them; God would never chastise them as they begged forgiveness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:34: But what have they now, that God should not chastise them, when they are barring from the Holy Mosque, not being its protectors? Its only protectors are the godfearing; but most of them know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:35: And their prayer at the House is nothing but a whistling and a clapping of hands -- therefore taste you now the chastisement for your unbelief!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:36: The unbelievers expend their wealth to bar from God’s way, and still they will expend it, till it is an anguish for them, then be overthrown, and the unbelievers will be mustered into Gehenna,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:37: that God may distinguish the corrupt from the good, and place the corrupt one upon another, and so heap them up all together, and put them in Gehenna; those are the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:38: Say to the unbelievers, if they give over He will forgive them what is past; but if they return, the wont of the ancients is already gone!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:39: Fight them, till there is no persecution and the religion is God’s entirely; then if they give over, surely God sees the things they do;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:40: but if they turn away, know that God is your Protector -- an excellent Protector, an excellent Helper!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:41: Know that, whatever booty you take, the fifth of it is God’s, and the Messenger’s, and the near kinsman’s, and the orphans’, and for the needy, and the traveller, if you believe in God and that We sent down upon Our servant on the day of salvation,.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:42: when you were on the nearer bank, and they were on the farther bank, and the cavalcade was below you; and had you made tryst together, you would have surely failed the tryst; but that God might determine a matter that was done, that whosoever perished might perish by a clear sign, and by a clear sign he might live who lived; and surely God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:43: When God showed thee them in thy dream as few; and had He shown them as many you would have lost heart, and quarrelled about the matter; but God saved; He knows the thoughts in the breasts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:44: When God showed you them in your eyes as few, when you encountered, and made you few in their eyes, that God might determine a matter that was done; and unto God all matters are returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:45: O believers, whensoever you encounter a host, then stand firm, and remember God frequently; haply so you will prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:46: And obey God, and His Messenger, and do not quarrel together, and so lose heart, and your power depart; and be patient; surely God is with the patient.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:47: Be not as those who went forth from their habitations swaggering boastfully to show off to men, and barring from God’s way; and God encompasses the things they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:48: And when Satan decked out their deeds fair to them, and said, ’Today no man shall overcome you, for I shall be your neighbour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:49: When the hypocrites, and those in whose hearts was sickness, said, ’Their religion has deluded them’; but whosoever puts his trust in God, surely God is All-mighty, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:50: If thou couldst only see when the angels take the unbelievers, beating their faces and their backs: ’Taste the chastisement of the burning --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:51: that, for what your hands have forwarded, and for that God is never unjust unto His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:52: Like Pharaoh’s folk, and the people before him, who disbelieved in God’s signs; God seized them because of their sins; God is strong, terrible in retribution.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:53: That is because God would never change His favour that He conferred on a people until they changed what was within themselves; and that God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:54: Like Pharaoh’s folk, and the people before him, who cried lies to the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them because of their sins, and We drowned the folk of Pharaoh; and all were evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:55: Surely the worst of beasts in God’s sight are the unbelievers, who will not believe,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:56: those of them with whom thou hast made compact then they break their compact every time, not being godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:57: So, if thou comest upon them anywhere in the war, deal with them in such wise as to scatter the ones behind them; haply they will remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:58: And if thou fearest treachery any way at the hands of a people, dissolve it with them equally; surely God loves not the treacherous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:59: And thou art not to suppose that they who disbelieve have outstripped Me; they cannot frustrate My will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:60: Make ready for them whatever force and strings of horses you can, to terrify thereby the enemy of God and your enemy, and others besides them that you know not; God knows them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:61: And if they incline to peace, do thou incline to it; and put thy trust in God; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:62: And if they desire to trick thee, God is sufficient for thee; He has confirmed thee with His help, and with the believers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:64: O Prophet, God suffices thee, and the believers who follow thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:65: O Prophet, urge on the believers to fight.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:66: Now God has lightened it for you, knowing that there is weakness in you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:67: It is not for any Prophet to have prisoners until he make wide slaughter in the land.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:68: Had it not been for a prior prescription from God, there had afflicted you, for what you took, a mighty chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:69: Eat of what you have taken as booty, such as is lawful and good; and fear you God; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:70: O Prophet, say to the prisoners in your hands: ’If God knows of any good in your hearts He will give you better than what has been taken from you, and He will forgive you; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:71: And if they desire treachery against thee, they have tricked God before; but He has given thee power over them; and God is All-knowing, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:72: Those who believe, and have emigrated and struggled with their possessions and their selves in the way of God, and those who have given refuge and help -- those are friends one of another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:73: As for the unbelievers, they are friends one of another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:74: And those who believe, and have emigrated and struggled in the way of God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 8:75: And those who have believed afterwards and emigrated, and struggled with you -- they belong to you; but those related by blood are nearer to one another in the Book of God; surely God has knowledge of everything.

Muhammad Asad.verse 8:1: THEY WILL ASK thee about the spoils of war.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:3: Believers are only they whose hearts tremble with awe whenever God is mentioned, and whose faith is strengthened whenever His messages are conveyed unto them, and who in their Sustainer place their trust –
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:4: those who are constant in prayer and spend on others out of what We provide for them as sustenance:
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:5: it is they, they who are truly believers! Theirs shall be great dignity in their Sustainer’s sight, and forgiveness of sins, and a most excellent sustenance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:6: EVEN AS thy Sustainer brought thee forth from thy home [to fight] in the cause of the truth, although some of the believers were averse to it,
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:7: [so, too,] they would argue with thee about the truth
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:8: after it had become manifest – just as if they were being driven towards death and beheld it with their very eyes.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:9: And, lo, God gave you the promise that one of the two
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:10: hosts would fall to you: and you would have liked to seize the less powerful one, whereas it was God’s will to prove the truth to be true in accordance with His words, and to wipe out the last remnant of those who denied the truth –
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:11: so that He might prove the truth to be true and the false to be false, however hateful this might be to those who were lost in sin.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:12: Lo! You were praying unto your Sustainer for aid, whereupon He thus responded to you: "I shall, verily, aid you with a thousand angels following one upon another!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:13: And God ordained this only as a glad tiding, and that your hearts should thereby be set at rest – since no succour can come from any save God: verily, God is almighty, wise!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:14: [Remember how it was] when He caused inner calm to enfold you, as an assurance from Him, and sent down upon you water from the skies, so that He might purify you thereby and free you from Satan’s unclean whisperings and strengthen your hearts and thus make firm your steps.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:15: Lo! Thy Sustainer inspired the angels [to convey this His message to the believers]: "I am with you!" [And He commanded the angels:] "And give firmness unto those who have attained to faith [with these words from Me]: ‘I shall cast terror into the hearts of those who are bent on denying the truth; strike, then, their necks, [O believers,] and strike off every one of their finger-tips!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:16: This, because they have cut themselves off from God and His Apostle: and as for him who cuts himself off from God and His Apostle – verily, God is severe in retribution.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:17: This [for you, O enemies of God]! Taste it, then, [and know] that suffering through fire awaits those who deny the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:18: O YOU who have attained to faith! When you meet in battle those who are bent on denying the truth, advancing in great force, do not turn your backs on them:
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:19: for whoever on that day turns his back on them – unless it be in a battle manoeuvre or in an endeavour to join another troop [of the believers] – shall indeed have earned the burden of God’s condemnation, and his goal shall be hell: and how vile a journey’s end!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:20: And yet, [O believers,] it was not you who slew the enemy, but it was God who slew them; and it was not thou who cast [terror into them, O Prophet], when thou didst cast it, but it was God who cast it: and [He did all this] in order that He might test the believers by a goodly test of His Own ordaining.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:21: This [was God’s purpose] – and also [to show] that God renders vain the artful schemes of those who deny the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:22: If you have been praying for victory, [O believers] – victory has now indeed come unto you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:25: O you who have attained to faith, pay heed unto God and His Apostle, and do not turn away from Him now that you hear [His message];
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:26: and be not like those who say, "We have heard," the while they do not hearken.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:27: Verily, the vilest of all creatures in the sight of God are those deaf, those dumb ones who do not use their reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:28: For, if God had seen any good in them, He would certainly have made them hear: but [as it is,] even if He had made them hear, they would surely have turned away in their obstinacy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:29: O you who have attained to faith! Respond to the call of God and the Apostle whenever he calls you unto that which will give you life; and know that God intervenes between man and [the desires of] his heart, and that unto Him you shall be gathered.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:30: And beware of that temptation to evil which does not befall only those among you who are bent on denying the truth, to the exclusion of others; and know that God is severe in retribution.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:31: And remember the time when you were few
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:32: helpless on earth, fearful lest people do away with you – whereupon He sheltered you, and strengthened you with His succour, and provided for you sustenance out of the good things of life, so that you might have cause to be grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:34: O you who have attained to faith, do not be false to God and the Apostle, and do not knowingly be false to the trust that has been reposed in you;
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:35: and know that your worldly goods and your children are but a trial and a temptation, and that with God there is a tremendous reward.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:36: O you who have attained to faith! If you remain conscious of God, He will endow you with a standard by which to discern the true from the false, and will efface your bad deeds, and will forgive you your sins: for God is limitless in His great bounty.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:37: AND [remember, O Prophet,] how those who were bent on denying the truth were scheming against thee, in order to restrain thee [from preaching], or to slay thee, or to drive thee away: thus have they
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:38: schemed: but God brought their scheming to nought – for God is above all schemers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:39: And whenever Our messages were conveyed to them, they would say, "We have heard [all this] before; if we wanted, we could certainly compose sayings like these :
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:40: they are nothing but fables of ancient times!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:41: And, lo, they would say, "O God! If this be indeed the truth from Thee, then rain down upon us stones from the skies, or inflict [some other] grievous suffering on us!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:42: But God did not choose thus to chastise them while thou [O Prophet] wert still among them, nor would God chastise them when they [might yet] ask for forgiveness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:44: in their favour that God should not chastise them – seeing that they bar [the believers] from the Inviolable House of Worship, although they are not its
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:45: guardians? None but the God-conscious can be its guardians: but of this most of these
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:47: and their prayers before the Temple are nothing but whistling and clapping of hands.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:48: Behold, those who are bent on denying the truth are spending their riches in order to turn others away from the path of God; and they will go on spending them until they become [a source of] intense regret for them; and then they will be overcome! And those who [until their death] have denied the truth shall be gathered unto hell,
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:49: so that God might separate the bad from the good, and join the bad with one another, and link them all together [within His condemnation], and then place them in hell.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:50: Tell those who are bent on denying the truth that if they desist, all that is past shall be forgiven them; but if they revert [to their wrongdoing], let them remember what happened to the like of them in times gone by.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:51: And fight against them until there is no more oppression and all worship is devoted to God alone.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:52: and if they turn away [from righteousness], know that God is your Lord Supreme:
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:53: how excellent is this Lord Supreme, and how excellent this Giver of Succour!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:54: AND KNOW that whatever booty you acquire [in war], one-fifth thereof belongs to God and the Apostle, and the near of kin, and the orphans, and the needy, and the wayfarer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:55: [Remember that day] when you were at the near end of the valley [of Badr], and they were at its farthest end, while the caravan was below you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:56: that he who would perish might perish in clear evidence of the truth, and that he who would remain alive might live in clear evidence of the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:57: Lo! God showed them to thee in a dream as few: for, had He shown them to you as many, you would surely have lost heart, and would surely have disagreed with one another about what to do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:58: And so, when you met in battle, He made them appear as few in your eyes – just as He made you appear as of little account in their eyes – so that God might accomplish a thing [which He willed] to be done: for all things go back to God [as their source].
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:60: O you who have attained to faith, when you meet a host in battle, be firm, and remember God often, so that you might attain to a happy state!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:61: And pay heed unto God and His Apostle, and do not [allow yourselves to] be at variance with one another, lest you lose heart and your moral strength desert you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:63: who went forth from their homelands full of self-conceit and a desire to be seen and praised by men: for they were trying to turn others away from the path of God – the while God encompassed all their doings [with His might].
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:64: And, lo, Satan made all their doings seem goodly to them, and said, "No one can overcome you this day, for, behold, I shall be your protector!" – but as soon as the two hosts came within sight of one another, he turned on his heels and said, "Behold, I am not responsible for you: behold, I see something that you do not see: behold, I fear God – for God is severe in retribution!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:65: At the same time, the hypocrites and those in whose hearts was disease were saying, "Their faith has deluded these !"
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:66: But he who places his trust in God [knows that], verily, God is almighty, wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:67: AND IF thou couldst but see [how it will be] when He causes those who are bent on denying the truth to die: the angels will strike their faces and their backs, and [will say]: "Taste suffering through fire
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:68: in return for what your own hands have wrought – for never does God do the least wrong to His creatures!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:69: [To them shall happen] the like of what happened to Pharaoh’s people and those who lived before them: they denied the truth of God’s messages – and so God took them to task for their sins.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:70: This, because God would never change the blessings with which He has graced a people unless they change their inner selves: and
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:72: [To those sinners shall happen] the like of what happened to Pharaoh’s people and those who lived before them: they gave the lie to their Sustainer’s messages – and so We destroyed them in return for their sins, and caused Pharaoh’s people to drown: for they were evildoers all.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:73: Verily, the vilest creatures in the sight of God are those who are bent on denying the truth and therefore do not believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:74: AS FOR THOSE with whom thou hast made a covenant, and who thereupon break their covenant on every occasion, not being conscious of God –
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:75: if thou find them at war [with you], make of them a fearsome example for those who follow them, so that they might take it to heart;
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:76: or, if thou hast reason to fear treachery from people [with whom thou hast made a covenant], cast it back at them in an equitable manner: for, verily, God does not love the treacherous!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:77: And let them not think – those who are bent on denying the truth – that they shall escape :
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:78: behold, they can never frustrate [His purpose].
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:79: Hence, make ready against them whatever force and war mounts you are able to muster, so that you might deter thereby the enemies of God, who are your enemies as well, and others besides them of whom you may be unaware,
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:80: of whom God is aware; and whatever you may expend in God’s cause shall be repaid to you in full, and you shall not be wronged.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:81: But if they incline to peace, incline thou to it as well, and place thy trust in God: verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:82: And should they seek but to deceive thee [by their show of peace] – behold, God is enough for thee! He it is who has strengthened thee with His succour, and by giving thee believing followers
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:83: whose hearts He has brought together:
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:84: if thou hadst expended all that is on earth, thou couldst not have brought their hearts together [by thyself]: but God did bring them together.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:85: O Prophet! God is enough for thee and those of the believers who follow thee!
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:86: O Prophet! Inspire the believers to conquer all fear of death when fighting, [so that,] if there be twenty of you who are patient in adversity, they might overcome two hundred; and
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:87: if there be one hundred of you, they might overcome one thousand of those who are bent on denying the truth, because they are people who cannot grasp it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:89: God has lightened your burden, for He knows that you are weak: and so, if there be one hundred of you who are patient in adversity, they should [be able to] overcome two hundred; and if there be one thousand of you, they should [be able to] overcome two thousand by God’s leave: for God is with those who are patient in adversity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:90: IT DOES NOT behove a prophet to keep captives unless he has battled strenuously on earth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:91: Had it not been for a decree from God that had already gone forth, there would indeed have befallen you a tremendous chastisement on account of all [the captives] that you took.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:92: Enjoy, then, all that is lawful and good among the things which you have gained in war, and remain conscious of God: verily, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:94: O Prophet, say unto the captives who are in your hands: "If God finds any good in your hearts, He will give you something better than all that has been taken from you, and will forgive you your sins: for God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:95: And should they but seek to play false with thee – well, they were false to God
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:96: ere this: but He gave [the believers] mastery over them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:97: BEHOLD, as for those who have attained to faith, and who have forsaken the domain of evil and are striving hard, with their possessions and their lives, in God’s cause, as well as those who shelter and succour
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:99: the friends and protectors of one another.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:100: this succour – except against a people between whom and yourselves there is a covenant: for God sees all that you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:101: With all this, [remember that] those who are bent on denying the truth are allies of one another; and unless you act likewise [among yourselves], oppression will reign on earth, and great corruption.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:102: And they who have attained to faith, and who have forsaken the domain of evil and are striving hard in God’s cause, as well as those who shelter and succour
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:103: – it is they, they who are truly believers! Forgiveness of sins awaits them, and a most excellent sustenance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:104: And as for those who henceforth come to believe, and who forsake the domain of evil and strive hard [in God’s cause] together with you – these
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:105: shall belong to you; and they who are
Muhammad Asad.verse 8:106: closely related have the highest claim on one another in [accordance with] God’s decree.

Martin Lings.verse 8:3: …I will help you with a thousand of the angels, troop on troop.
Martin Lings.verse 8:4: When thy Lord revealed unto the angels: Lo, I am with you, so make firm the believers.

Martin Lings.verse 8:7: …God cometh in between a man and his own heart.
Martin Lings.verse 8:10: Fight them until there is no longer any sedition, and religion is all for God.
Martin Lings.verse 8:11: If thou overcomest them in war, then make of them an example, to strike fear into those that are behind them, that they may take heed.
Martin Lings.verse 8:12: If thou fearest treachery from any folk, then throw back unto them their covenant.
Martin Lings.verse 8:13: If they incline unto peace, incline thou also unto it, and trust in God.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:1: They ask you about the spoils.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:2: Certainly, the believers are those whose hearts are filled with awe when (the name of) Allah is mentioned; and when His verses are recited to them, it makes them more developed in faith; and in their Lord they place their trust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:3: (They are) those who establish Salāh, and give away from what We have given to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:4: Those are the believers in reality.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:5: It is like when your Lord made you leave your home for the sake of truth, while a group from the believers were averse to it;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:6: they were disputing with you about the truth after it became clear, as if they were being driven to death being seen by them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:7: And recall when Allah was promising you that one of the two groups would become yours, and you were wishing that the one without strength should fall to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:8: so that He proves the truth to be true and the falsehood to be false, even though the sinners might dislike it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:9: When you were calling your Lord for help, so He responded to you (saying): “I am going to support you with one thousand of the angels, one following the other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:10: And Allah has made it (the promise) merely to give you a good news, and so that your hearts might be at rest thereby.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:11: When He covered you with drowsiness, as tranquility (descending) from Him and sent down upon you water from the heavens, so that He might purify you with it, and remove from you the impurity of Satan, and so that He might strengthen your hearts and make (your) feet firm therewith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:12: When your Lord revealed to the angels: “I am with you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:13: That is because they were hostile to Allah and His Messenger; and whoever becomes hostile to Allah and His Messenger, then, Allah is severe at punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:14: That is what you have to taste, and for the disbelievers is the (further) punishment of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:15: O you who believe, when you face the disbelievers in a battle, do not turn your backs to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:16: Whoever turns his back to them on such a day,- unless it is for a tactic in the battle, or to join a company,-turns with wrath from Allah, and his abode is Jahannam (Hell), and it is an evil place to return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:17: So, it is not you who killed them, but in fact Allah killed them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:18: Apart from that, Allah is the One who frustrates the device of the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:19: (O unbelievers,) if you were looking for a decision, the ‘decision’ has come upon you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:20: O you who believe, obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not turn away from Him when you listen (to him).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:21: And do not be like those who say, “We have listened” while they do not listen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:22: Surely, the worst of all animals in the sight of Allah are the deaf and the dumb who do not understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:23: Had Allah seen in them some good, He would have made them listen (as due).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:24: O you who believe, respond to Allah and the Messenger when He calls you to what gives you life, and be sure that Allah intervenes between man and his heart, and that to Him you shall be gathered.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:25: And beware of a scourge that shall not fall only on the wrongdoers from among you, and know well that Allah is severe at punishment
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:26: Recall when you were few in number, oppressed on the earth, fearing that the people would snatch you away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:27: O you who believe, do not betray the trust of Allah and the Messenger-, and do not betray your mutual trusts, while you know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:28: Be aware that your wealth and your children are but a trial and that with Allah there is a great reward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:29: O you who believe, if you fear Allah, He will provide you with a criterion (to distinguish between right and wrong) and will write off your evil deeds and will forgive you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:30: And (recall) when the disbelievers were conspiring against you to hold you as a captive, or to kill you, or to expel you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:31: When Our verses are recited to them, they say, “We have heard; if we wish, we can compose a discourse like this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:32: And (recall) when they said, “O Allah, if this is indeed the truth (revealed) from You, then, rain down stones upon us from the heavens, or bring upon us a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:33: And Allah was not to send scourge upon them while you (O Prophet), were in their midst, nor would Allah send scourge upon them while they are seeking forgiveness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:34: And what privilege do they have that Allah should not punish them, while they prevent (people) from Al-Masjid-ul-Harām (the Sacred Mosque), even though they are not (competent to be) its custodians? Its (competent) custodians are none but the God-fearing, but most of them do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:35: And their prayer near the House was not more than whistling and clapping.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:36: Surely, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to prevent (people) from the way of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:37: so that Allah may separate the wicked from the good people, and join the wicked with each other, and heaps them all together, and puts them into Jahannam .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:38: Say to those who disbelieve that if they desist (from infidelity), they shall be forgiven for what has passed (of their sins), and if they repeat, then, the precedent of the earlier people is already established (that the infidels are punished).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:39: And fight them until there is no Fitnah (mischief), and total obedience becomes for Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:40: And if they turn away, then, rest assured that Allah is your protector.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:41: And know that whatever spoils you receive, its one fifth is for Allah and for His Messenger, and for kinsmen and orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, if you do believe in Allah and in what We have sent down upon Our Servant on the decisive day, the day when the two forces encountered each other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:42: (Remember) when you were on the nearest end of the valley, and they were on the farthest one, and the caravan was downwards from you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:43: (Recall) when in your dream, Allah showed them to you few in number.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:44: And when, at the time you met each other, He showed them to you few in number in your eyes, and reduced your number in their eyes, so that Allah might accomplish what was destined to be done.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:45: O you who believe, when you face a group (in battle), stand firm and remember Allah abundantly, so that you may be successful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:46: Obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not quarrel with each other, lest you should lose courage, and your prowess should evaporate; and be patient.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:47: And do not be like those who set forth from their homes waxing proud and showing off to people, preventing (people) from the way of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:48: When the Satan made their deeds look beautiful to their eyes, and said, “None of the people can overpower you today, and I am a protector for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:49: When the hypocrites and those who have a malady in their hearts said, “The belief of these people has deluded them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:50: Only if you were to see (them) when the angels take out the souls of those who disbelieve, beating their faces and their backs, and (saying) “Taste the punishment of the flaming Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:51: That is due to what your hands sent ahead, and that Allah is not cruel to (His) servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:52: (Their way is) like the way of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:53: All this is because Allah is not the one who may change a favour He has conferred on a people unless they change their own condition, and that Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:54: Their practice is like that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:55: Surely, the worst of all the moving creatures, in the sight of Allah, are those who reject Faith and do not believe
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:56: -those with whom you have entered into a treaty, then they break their treaty each time, and they do not fear Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:57: So, if you find them in war, deal with them in a way that those behind them have to disperse fearfully, so that they take a lesson.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:58: And if you apprehend a breach from a people, then, throw (the treaty) towards them in straight-forward terms.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:59: The disbelievers should never think that they have surpassed (the divine punishment).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:60: Prepare against them whatever force you can, and the trained horses whereby you frighten Allah’s enemy and your own enemy and others besides them whom you do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:61: And if they tilt towards peace, you too should tilt towards it, and place your trust in Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:62: If they intend to deceive you, then, Allah is all-sufficient for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:64: O Prophet, Allah is sufficient for you, and the believers who followed you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:65: O Prophet, rouse the believers to fighting.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:66: Now Allah has lightened your burden, and He knew that there is weakness in you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:67: It is not befitting a prophet that he has captives with him unless he has subdued the enemy by shedding blood in the land.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 8:68: Had there not been a decree from Allah that came earlier, a great punishment would have overtaken you because of what you have taken.
